GIS.geometry

Class GISPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • GIS.geometry.Geometry
      • GIS.geometry.GISPoint

  • public class GISPoint
extends Geometry
    Point Class, inherits from Geometry. (GISPoint because Point class already exists in Java.awt) Coordinates can be added with the Method "createPoint()", that will add values to x and y. To write Feature in DB or CSV the coordinates can be transformed to the right format using "writeAsText()". To read it from a DB or CSV use "textToPoint()" To get a drawable geometry for Graphics2D use "getGeometry()"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double x
      The X coordinate of a point object, default 0
      double y
      The Y coordinate of a point object, default 0

      • Fields inherited from class GIS.geometry.Geometry

        id, type

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GISPoint()
      Creates an empty Point Object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean createPoint(double x, double y)
      assign x and y values derived from the plotting area to the objects attributes: this.x = x this.y = y return true when processed sucessfull
      java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D getGeometry()
      returns an Ellipse2D object which can be drawn
      java.lang.String getGeometryAsText()
      write the point so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded.
      double getX()
      returns X coordinate (the attribute x) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
      double getY()
      returns Y coordinate (the attribute y) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
      boolean setGeometryFromText(java.lang.String geometry)
      when receiving a point from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678" setGeometryFromText("1.234 5.678") will split the string at the " " and return an Array with x and y values, which then can be assigned to this.x and this.y.

      • Methods inherited from class GIS.geometry.Geometry

        getID, getType, setUniqueID

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • x

        public double x
        The X coordinate of a point object, default 0

      • y

        public double y
        The Y coordinate of a point object, default 0

    • Constructor Detail

      • GISPoint

        public GISPoint()
        Creates an empty Point Object. Constructor calls the constructor of the super class (Geometry) and sets the type

    • Method Detail

      • createPoint

        public boolean createPoint(double x,
                           double y)
        assign x and y values derived from the plotting area to the objects attributes: this.x = x this.y = y return true when processed sucessfull
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate
        y - Y coordinate
        Returns:
        true when successful, false when faulty

      • getGeometryAsText

        public java.lang.String getGeometryAsText()
        write the point so that they can be stored as a string in a DB/CSV and be reconstructed to a Point when loaded. should be something like that: this.x = 1.234 this.y = 5.678 getGeometryAsText() "1.234 5.678"
        Returns:
        String with the Geometry as readable Text

      • setGeometryFromText

        public boolean setGeometryFromText(java.lang.String geometry)
        when receiving a point from a DB/CSV it will be stored in the string: "1.234 5.678" setGeometryFromText("1.234 5.678") will split the string at the " " and return an Array with x and y values, which then can be assigned to this.x and this.y. return true when processed successful
        Parameters:
        geometry - a String received from getGeometryAsText()
        Returns:
        true when method was sucessfull, false for errors

      • getGeometry

        public java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D getGeometry()
        returns an Ellipse2D object which can be drawn
        Returns:
        Ellipse2D with X and Y coordinates and a radius of 5

      • getX

        public double getX()
        returns X coordinate (the attribute x) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
        Returns:
        X coordinate

      • getY

        public double getY()
        returns Y coordinate (the attribute y) (if the attribute is not filled yet, tell the user to use createPoint)
        Returns:
        Y coordinate
